metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript was invented by Brendan Eich in 1995, and became an ECMA standard in 1997.
content.html: JavaScript was invented by Brendan Eich in 1995, and became an ECMA standard in 1997.

content.text: ECMAScript is the official name of the language.
content.html: ECMAScript is the official name of the language.

content.text: ECMAScript versions have been abbreviated to ES1, ES2, ES3, ES5, and ES6.
content.html: ECMAScript versions have been abbreviated to ES1, ES2, ES3, ES5, and ES6.

content.text: Since 2016, versions are named by year (ECMAScript 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020).
This tutorial covers every version of JavaScript:
content.html: This tutorial covers every version of JavaScript:

content.text: ECMAScript 1 - 6 is fully supported in all modern browsers.
content.html: ECMAScript 1 - 6 is fully supported in all modern browsers.

content.text: * Internet Explorer 9 does not support ECMAScript 5 "use strict".
content.html: * Internet Explorer 9 does not support ECMAScript 5 "use strict".

content.text: Internet Explorer does not support ECMAScript 2015.
